title: boxer
content:
i am new here and my english is still ugly bad  
i apologize again  
but i will try  
i made an illustration to the topic boxer (sport)  
the style is modern and a kind of abstract

i have a small text for it and i would like to use a font which captivate the very essence  
of this sport

i have three ideas:

house gothic bold three  
blur bold and in some way  
trixie

(for dynamic,elegant,raw,virile, fast)

any suggestion?

best regards!

supay

 [‹ Does the weight of this S look ok](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121165456/http:/typophile.com/node/38006 "Go to previous forum topic") [Testsheet for Opentype character sets (Western, Central Eurpoean) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121165456/http:/typophile.com/node/37992 "Go to next forum topic")
author: supay

comments.content: do you have an image we can see?

Maybe to obvious, but what about HFJs Knockout?  
 [http://typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100013](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121165456/http:/typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100013 "http://typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100013")

well hm of course an image, this would certain help  
i am paranoid about this  
i dont want to show it before i am ready  
i am afraid its silly  
this boxer guy is more kind of an oldfashioned heavy italo hero  
with very long shorts and extrem strong hands  
a nice guy with a black eye  
after the 12th round  
i think he won  
its abstract but children have to recognize him instantly

knockout is heavy its almost perfekt  
but knockout is not fast enough sigh

il futurismo: oooughhhhmmmm no no no

but at p22: bifur two-color font by adolfe mouron cassandre!!

[http://www.p22.com/ihof/bifurcd.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121165456/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/bifurcd.html "http://www.p22.com/ihof/bifurcd.html")

i think this is the way?
